Yea, this is about the tricks that are used to raise experience 
points.

For example, did you know defeated scenarios are the ideal ground for 
raising experience points because there are no opponents around?

Yea, take any *summoned* character raise its experience level up using 
the cheat codes, turn the summoned character into a medium slime in a 
predictament where the slime will die.  Once the medium slime "dies", 
the new small slime has the health points of the new experience level. 
 From there, you can use the slime as target practice for either 
thieves or archers to gain experience points.  Or you could turn the 
slime into an Archer and use the exploding bolt attack to nearly kill 
yourself.  Then bring your cleric nearby to start healing your wounded 
 archer.  Repeat process until cleric gets to desired experience 
level.

[Zardus, in OpenGlad, make sure to change things so you can *NOT* get 
experience points while playing a level you already defeated.  Sorry, 
but I view that as a problem.]

Another trick is for an elf to switch to "bouncing rocks" or more 
powerfull attack.  Then move the elf next to a solid wall and start 
firing away.  The elf will actually gain mana in this manner.  It's a 
really nice way to recharge mana in a hurry. :-)

Do you guys know any other tricks in the game?
